comments:
INSR 232, or Risk Management and Treatment, discusses the nature and objectives of corporate risk management. Primary consideration is devoted to the recognition, evaluation, and treatment of pure risks to which the corporation is exposed. 

Students cited the class as “innovative” and “mostly discussion based.” Some explained that it “lacked clear structure” but hit on many topics in the world’s economy, making it a good course for non-majors. 

Professor Lamm-Tenant was praised for her “passion” when teaching. She also “did a great job of bringing her real life experiences to the class.” Some students felt that she should have brought more structure to the classroom because the discussions, while informative, would occasionally get sidetracked. 

Students requested more feedback throughout the semester on their performance in Risk Management and Treatment. This review is based upon 5 critiques of the course.
